etymology.description: 陈 + 毅 = surname Chen + resolute/steadfast → a given name.
etymology.interpretation: A Chinese personal name consisting of the surname 陈 and the given name 毅. Famously borne by Marshal Chen Yi, a prominent PRC military leader and later foreign minister.
etymology.simplification: 陳 → 陈 by simplifying 東 to 东; 毅 unchanged. Simplified to reduce strokes and standardize a high-frequency surname.

parts.english: surname Chen; to state; to display; old/stale

examples.chinese: 陈毅是中华人民共和国的元帅之一(陳毅是中華人民共和國的元帥之一)。
examples.pinyin: Chén Yì shì Zhōnghuá Rénmín Gònghéguó de yuánshuài zhī yī.
examples.english: Chen Yi was one of the marshals of the People’s Republic of China.

examples.chinese: 陈毅曾担任外交部长(陳毅曾擔任外交部長)。
examples.pinyin: Chén Yì céng dānrèn wàijiāo bùzhǎng.
examples.english: Chen Yi once served as foreign minister.

examples.chinese: 人们常引用陈毅的诗词(人們常引用陳毅的詩詞)。
examples.pinyin: Rénmen cháng yǐnyòng Chén Yì de shīcí.
examples.english: People often quote Chen Yi’s poems.
